music

Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • music.Utilities

  • public final class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Common utilities which are used throughout the project Immutable.

      Computes a value of ticksPerBeat that allows us to represent all the given chords.

      Returns the greatest common denominator of two non-negative integers, which cannot both be zero (since gcd(0, 0) is undefined).

      Computes a list of ReadyToAddItems (notes and lyrics), given a list of Chords.

      Computes a list of ReadyToAddItems (notes and lyrics), given a list of Chords and the desired granularity of ticks (i.e., the number of ticks per beat).
      static int lcm(int a, int b)
      Returns the (positive) least common multiple of two integers, neither of which can be zero.

      • arrayToList

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> arrayToList(T[] array)
        Returns an immutable list copy of a given array (that is no longer tied to the array).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type
        Parameters:
        array - the array
        Returns:
        an immutable copy of the array, in list form

      • computeTicksPerBeat

        public static int computeTicksPerBeat(java.util.List<Chord> chords)
        Computes a value of ticksPerBeat that allows us to represent all the given chords.
        Parameters:
        chords - the list of chords that will be played
        Returns:
        a valid value of ticksPerBeat (every duration of every chord/note in the input must be representable as an integer number of ticks)

        Parameters:
        list - the list
        Returns:

        Flattens a list of ChordSequences into a list of Chords
        Parameters:
        chordSequences - the list of chord sequences (so, effectively, a list of lists of chords)
        Returns:
        the flattened list of chords

      • gcd

        public static int gcd(int a,
      int b)
        Returns the greatest common denominator of two non-negative integers, which cannot both be zero (since gcd(0, 0) is undefined).
        Parameters:
        a - first integer
        b - second integer
        Returns:
        gcd(a, b)

        public static java.util.List<ReadyToAddItem> getReadyToAddItems(java.util.List<Chord> chords)

        Returns:
        the notes/lyrics

      • getReadyToAddItems

        public static java.util.List<ReadyToAddItem> getReadyToAddItems(java.util.List<Chord> chords,
                                                int ticksPerBeat)
        Computes a list of ReadyToAddItems (notes and lyrics), given a list of Chords and the desired granularity of ticks (i.e., the number of ticks per beat).
        Parameters:
        chords - the chords
        ticksPerBeat - the number of ticks in a beat
        Returns:
        the notes/lyrics
